**<u>SDEC:</u>**

**<u>Blood transfusions:</u>**

Book onto medical tracker for SDEC team to contact. Do not give an
arrival time. Ensure bloods sent from ED including 2 x G+S as
facilitates the quicker requesting of red cells from blood bank.

**<u>PE / DVT - Pregnant Patients:</u>**

**Gestation: 16 weeks and under: to SDEC, over 16 weeks and if 6 weeks
or less postpartum: via Obstetrics reg**

[**370_ThromboembolismPregnancy_VTE
pathway_CGSupp_2_1_0**](https://derby.koha-ptfs.co.uk/cgi-bin/koha/opac-retrieve-file.pl?id=2078ac6370855027cd7c1a93a54998bd)

Ensure information leaflet given to patient (see attachment in ED
survival guide channel O+G folder)

**<u>Frailty:</u>**

In hours patients can be referred frailty (544) if medical input
required, or if therapies only then to PT / OT (290). **Out of hours
patient requiring input from these services must be referred to the
medical registrar to ensure comfort and rest as well as being clerked by
the medical team so regular medications are prescribed.**

**<u>If patients are being admitted to DAU then it is the treating
clinicians responsibility to prescribe all the regular medications.
Please all ensure time critical medications are prescribed
promptly.</u>**

**<u>Rheumatology:</u>**

Please send any referrals to burton referrals (to open a pathway) and
the rheumatology secretaries. Provide a summary (copy and pasting V6
notes is fine!) and patient details. This will be reviewed by a QHB
rheumatology consultant. Ensure the ED on call consultant is cc'd into
the email.

uhdb.bhft.burtonreferrals@nhs.net

<rheumatology.secretariesqhb@nhs.net>

**<u>Dermatology:</u>**

Please send an email to the below address. Also complete a V6 referral
on Meditech. In orders type 'cons' and then choose the dermatology
option. Ensure the ED on call consultant is cc'd into the email.

<dhft.burtondermatologyteam@nhs.net>

**In hours**: Use V6 to request medical photography.

If out of hours:

**Option 1:** Put a V6 order but then tell the patient to contact
medical photography the next day. Via switchboard Ext 5299

**Option 2:** Take your own photos through outlook (This is IG
compliant) and send via email to <uhdb.qhbphotographic@nhs.net>. Ensure
name, NHS number and DOB including urgency of upload and date taken.

**Medical Photography:**

**<u>Option 2 can also be used for safeguarding concerns out of hours
and if patient requires transfer to tertiary centre eg burns</u>**

**<u>Neurology:</u>**

First seizure referrals will be the most common reason for this. They
are booked into a general neurology clinic. Advise patients that there
is a long wait time. Please use the email address below. Ensure the ED
on call consultant is cc'd into the email.

<dhft.referrals@nhs.net>

**<u>Infectious Diseases:</u>**

**<u>QHB Internal suspected TB referral pathway:</u>**

Patients suspecting to have TB (based on clinical presentation and/or
CXR findings, please send an email referral to
[**uhdb.tbserviceburton@nhs.net**](mailto:uhdb.tbserviceburton@nhs.net).

During weekdays, you can contact **<u>TB specialist nurse on extension
5050</u>**.

If these patients need hospital admission, must go through acute medical
intake as usual. (chest physicians)

If the reporting radiographers are worried about CXR findings suspicious
of TB, they now will refer to the burton TB service team via email.

**<u>QHB Rabies vaccine pathway:</u>**

Usually, patients present to ED with h/o dog or wild animal bites when
on recent holiday and was advised to get Rabies vaccines when returned
to UK.

We keep **<u>rabies vaccines (RABIPUR)</u>** in our POH cupboard (3-4
vials in the Fridge). We must take one form these and administer the
dose as IM injection.

We then need to complete the risk assessment; the assessing clinician
should then contact RIgS at UKHSA via **0330 128 1020**

RIgS will take details of the patient, their GP surgery address and our
NHS email address (to which they will send the completed risk assessment
from which needs to be attached to the patient records). They will send
2 vials to the patient's GP surgery and advice which dates they need to
have these 2 doses. They will also replace the used Rabipur vaccine from
QHB POH cupboard.

Weekends and Bank Holidays 9am – 7pm (Colindale Duty Doctor Service
hours) Follow the above process, but instead of contacting RIgS, contact
the Colindale Duty Doctor Service via 0208 200 4400.

**<u>Note: UK is not an endemic nation for Rabies and so we do not
usually give "Immunoglobulins" and so do not have in hour
hospital.</u>**

**<u>Trauma:</u>**

<u>**Major Trauma (Adult):** </u>

Royal Stoke University Hospital (UHNM) is our referral centre for Chest
Trauma and Poly Trauma 

<u>**Cardiothoracic referrals:** </u>

Via referapatient (chest wall reconstruction) 

For urgent advice, call UHNM switchboard (#6136) and ask for the
Cardiothoracic Registrar On-Call 

**<u>Neurosurgical referrals:</u>**

Via referapatient (Queen’s Medical Centre, Nottingham)

Neurosurgical registrar: 07812 275352

**<u>Burns – Predominantly Nottingham City:</u>**

1st: SHO on call mobile: 07812 276431

Adult Clinic NCH: 0115 9691169 EX 76405

Paeds Clinic QMC: 82388 / 80364

Burns Outreach team 07812275381

**<u>Please send pictures using outlook if needed (see medical
photography section). This is vital to be IG compliant.</u>**

**For paediatric burns patients NCH recommend:**

Referrals / Advice:

1.  All referrals will be directed to the plastics doctors on call

2.  If over a weekend or weeknight the burns and plastics nurses will
    triage referrals on a weekday morning and book appointments as
    required.

3.  If patients are not required to come to QMC we can provide support
    and guidance as required

4.  Dressings clinic is open Monday – Friday 8-4pm and is predominately
    nurse led.

**<u>Hand referrals to RDH:</u>**

Contact Hand Fellow Via RDH switchboard

Mobile 07788 388457

Please send a copy of the Cas sheet to dhft.hands@nhs.net

<u>**Poly Trauma:** </u>

Contact UHNM switchboard (#6136) and ask for them to page the Trauma
Team Leader (TTL) 

**In event of immediately life or limb threatening trauma presenting to
QHB, EPIC is to contact the Regional Trauma Desk to activate the
appropriate pathway:** 

[Trauma Network Guideline
Hyperlink](https://nebula.wsimg.com/e144f1677e73c4238c1e20d52aae3cde?AccessKeyId=71C7B1EA5618F4C499E1&disposition=0&alloworigin=1) 

**<u>Regional Trauma Desk (WMAS): </u>**

Hospital Line (call first):  01384215697 

Emergency Line (if above fails): 01384215695 

 

**<u>Major Trauma (Paediatric)</u>** 

Birmingham Children's Hospital is our local Paediatric Major Trauma
Centre.  

ALL children with trauma needing a transfer to the Children’s MTC
(Birmingham Children’s Hospital) should be referred via KIDS (Kids
Critical Care and Intensive Support). 

**Do not phone ED or a Specialty area or the RTD.** 

**KIDS Tel: 0300 200 1100** 

KIDS will facilitate the call and provide TTL advice when required 

KIDS will be used in a coordination capacity and will not necessarily
move the child. If the patient is time critical it will still fall on
the local team to transfer
